Compare
Designing a platform from scratch.
In 2019 I had an idea of creating an automatic price comparison site for products, like Skyscanner is for flights. Until then, no one had done it with a Site Scraper. In order to make it happen, I contacted Snir, a friend and the CTO of Freshboard, to join the team and develop the product.
Laying down the foundation
Creating a design language
Due to the fact that there are a lot of images in the product, I wanted to simplify the processing of the information. To do this, I used a clean white design languge with strong colors that will highlight the prices.
I created a design system that includes a library of UI components, enabling Compare to have a consistent user interface throughout its online presence.
After understanding what pages we need and the user flow, I began researching each individual page thoroughly.

At the time, I was happy that I had the opportunity to get it done right.
We kicked off the project with an analysis phase where we came together to define the product, research the market, and ideate on possible User Flows.
Doing so, we gained insights into the users’ needs, thus helping us make the best product possible.
The problem
The users
The goal
It is hard to compare a lot of e-commerce prices and save money.
People who buy online and want to save money. Although they can be of any age, online shoppers are usually in a younger age group.
Providing a frictionless and easy experience for looking up the product that the user wants to compare.
We worked on this project every tuesday as a side project and we made great progress in product development. Unfortunately, after months of work, the project wasn’t released due to the developer’s lack of time.
